review_title: Important work, competent people, relaxed environment, 10/10
pros:
Important work. If you are invested in higher ed/equity, then Rivet School is likely a great match for you. This program serves students who face the common barriers to education (cost, caretaking responsibilities, time, etc.), and provides them with a very high quality level of support as they pursue their degrees (AA and BA). It's meaningful to contribute to this work and take part in the journeys of Rivet's highly resilient students. 

No surprises, ever. There are very clear expectations at all levels of this organization. Working with highly organized and highly competent people means that everything you need to know to do your job effectively is spelled out for you very clearly. 

Great people. The folks who work here are kind, competent, collaborative, and social-justice focused. We are a mix of introverts and extroverts, all of whom know how to make anyone feel welcome and at home on this team.


A few others:

-High compensation plans
-Highly efficient meetings (AKA very little wasted time) 
-Great benefits 
-Lots team building/team culture events 
-Still growing / start up mode so there are regularly improvements and adjustments being made to org policies based on feedback given
cons: Just like any student-facing role, sometimes the work itself can't be turned off because these are real people who need support. Managers work well to support and enforce policies that help coaches to maintain work / life boundaries, but the high-need population served can sometimes translate into weak boundaries.

review_title: All of my friends are jealous of my job!
pros:
Some of the pros of working at Rivet School are
- Professional and pleasant team dynamic
- Clear role expectations
- Flexible work hours
- Output-focused managers
- Feedback culture
cons: I've been a part of the Rivet team for 8 months now and there are no downsides!

pros:
- Holds true to their value of No BS. Honest in communication from Board to entry-level teammates
- Team has a growth mindset which contributes to a team of innovative thinkers, creativity is key, and challenges are seen as opportunities for growth.
- Real feedback is a norm. It's given early, often, and honestly.
- Good healthcare package and PTO
- Work from home flexibility
- Genuine group of people to work with that value hard work, excellence, and supporting our students to reach their goals
- Full ownership over your work. Having your opinions heard on how to restructure or update processes and having the ability to make real changes.
cons:
- Small team so team members will take on many roles which can be challenging
- No retirement plan yet (401K)

review_title: Hard to imagine a better workplace environment or team
pros:
- Team members and students who are genuine, empathetic, open to feedback, and competent
- Quality work produced across the team. Things are systematized, well-documented, organized, and clear
- Serious investment in diversity, equity, and inclusion, with initiatives like the White Fragility book club, DEI coffee chats, and DEI priorities incorporated into org-level goals
- Solid health and vacation benefits
- Org leaders who are committed to the right set of values, and who don't have egos
- Ability to work from home at least one day a week, and flex hours as needed
- A willingness to grapple with tough philosophical questions and raise disagreements about how we do our work
- Ability to serve students who haven't been well-served by the traditional college system, with clear results from our efforts (some students have earned their AAs in less than 6 months)
cons:
- We do well in helping students navigate an existing broken system, but we could do more to try to change the system
- Org is still in startup mode, which means more opportunities to build and improve things, but also ambiguity and times when we don't meet our ambitious goals
